dialogues.text: It's another normal day. I'm Zack, and I'm 12 years old.
At this school, aside from Bob, almost no one wants to talk with me.
Maybe it's because I'm too shy. Every time I try to speak, I blush before I can say anything.
(Zack lowers his head and hugs his toy tightly)
But... with Bob here, at least someone listens to me.
Bob is always kind. Though he can be a bit clumsy, he really tries to be a good friend.
There is also Louis. She's the class star, not only because she is pretty but also because she has tens of thousands of fans on TikTok.
But Louis never notices someone like me. Her world seems very far away from me.
(Zack opens his backpack, and inside is a toy that fills almost the whole bag)
But... no matter what happens, Aether is always by my side.
(Muffled laughter comes from classmates in the background)
Ha ha, still hugging a toy, so childish!
Look, he's even talking to a doll!
(Zack's face turns bright red)
(softly) I am not...
(Zack hugs his toy and runs out of the classroom)
(He reaches a corner in the hallway and sits on the floor, head down)
(Suddenly, a familiar voice speaks)
Don't mind them, Zack. They don't understand you.
But... am I really that strange?
Not strange. Everyone has their own way to feel safe. It's just... you're growing up now.
Growing up... really?
Yes. When you were young, you needed me like air. Now, maybe you should try to meet real people.
But I'm scared... I'm not good at talking to others.
No one is born knowing how. Like walking, you learn step by step.
I will always be here. But I hope to see you make real friends.
(Zack hugs his toy and nods softly)
...Yes. I will try.

events.title: Bob's Online Meet-up

dialogues.text: The weather is nice today. The playground is full of people sunbathing.
Bob said he needed to see me this morning. I wonder why.
(Bob walks quickly toward Zack)
Hey Zack, finally found you!
What's up? You look excited.
Actually... I met a girl online. She is from the girls' school next door. Her name is Lisa.
Really? You made a friend online?
Yeah... But it's not random. She added me after noting her school and class. We've chatted almost two weeks and even shared club info. It feels real.
That sounds more trustworthy than most online friends. Knowing club details is hard to fake.
Yes, and she told me to meet where many people are, not alone. She said I could bring a friend if I was not sure.
She mentioned safety tips herself? That seems more credible.
So she asked us to meet at a coffee shop after school. It's right behind the school and opens at the right time. She will wear a yellow jacket and sit by the window.
Yellow jacket, by the window... easy to spot.
I'm still a bit nervous. It's the first in-person meet. Zack, can you come with me? It will feel safer.

choices.text: Go with Bob to meet her for safety.

dialogues.text: Sure, I'll go with you. For a first meeting, it's safer in a crowd.
Great! I feel much better with you here.
(Time passes, now at the coffee shop)
(They open the door and see a girl in a yellow jacket by the window waving)
Hi, I'm Lisa.
So she is really friendly.
(The three chat happily.)

choices.text: Advise Bob not to go to reduce risk.

dialogues.text: Honestly, meeting online friends can be risky. Maybe you should not go.
I know you mean well, but... I still want to try. She gave real details, and I'll be careful.
(Time passes, now at the coffee shop)
(Bob sends a message)
It went well. Lisa is real and very nice. Too bad you didn't come.
Glad nothing bad happened, but we should stay safe next time.

events.summary: Though there are many bad people online, the internet is not as scary as it seems. You need to judge with care, feel the kindness online while noticing danger.

events.title: Suspicious Group Chat

dialogues.text: The break time finally arrived, and I felt like I could relax a bit.
I wonder what Bob is up to, as he mentioned something interesting in the morning.
(Bob comes over with his phone)
Zack, come here, I've joined a super interesting new group.
What group is it? Another group of prank videos?
No, this time it's different. This group is from a forum I saw, called "Everyday is a Holiday".
It sounds like a positive group? Sharing jokes?
Not really... People here say that there's a drug that can make you super happy really quickly. It seems like after taking it, all your worries disappear.
(Bob shows Zack the chat history)
Drug? What drug? From a doctor?
They didn't say the exact name, but they've been saying it's very effective, and someone has even posted a photo. It looks like little capsules.
It sounds a bit strange... If it's really effective, why would they hide it in a group chat?
And they also said that you can buy it just by scanning a code. It's very cheap.
It sounds more and more suspicious...
I think so too. But they've been saying it's so amazing, I can't help but be curious.

choices.text: Tell Bob not to bother with this group and leave it.

dialogues.text: This sounds suspicious. If there's really a problem, we might not even be able to protect ourselves.
You're right, I also feel uneasy about it. I'll leave now.
(Bob leaves the group)

choices.text: Curious to continue reading the group chat, see what else is there.

dialogues.text: Let's see, maybe we can figure out what's going on.
(Bob continues browsing the chat history)
(More photos and contact information about drug promotion appear)
This doesn't seem like a normal group anymore. It's like they're doing something illegal.
(Although they haven't left the group yet, Zack and Bob are on alert, and they leave on their own)

events.summary: On the internet, group chats from unknown sources can contain risky information. Even out of curiosity, you shouldn't join or get too involved. The most effective way to protect yourself is to stay away when you encounter suspicious information. Taking precautions is more important than fixing things after the fact.

events.title: Shadow of Online Bullying

dialogues.text: The atmosphere in the break time feels a bit strange today. There's not much noise on the playground.
Louis usually stands out a lot, but today he's just sitting alone in a corner.
(Zack approaches Louis)
Hey, Louis, what's up? You don't seem like your usual self today.
What's it to you? Don't you see I'm busy?
Uh... I just feel you might not be feeling well.
(Louis is silent for a moment)
...... The comments under my video yesterday were all about me. Someone said I was faking it, someone said I was fake, and someone even sent me nasty messages privately.
How come? Your content has always been popular, right?
That's how it is online. Today, someone likes you, tomorrow they can step on you.
So you're just going to keep it all to yourself?
Of course, I still have to maintain my image. I'm Louis, not a little transparent nobody.
But everyone has their moments of sadness, you don't have to pretend everything's fine all the time.
You don't understand... If all my fans leave, I'll really be nothing.
(Zack thinks for a moment)
Or, after school, why don't we go buy some ice cream? We don't have to explain anything, just talk as friends.
...... Whatever, I don't have any plans for today anyway.
(The atmosphere becomes a bit more relaxed)

choices.text: Encourage Louis to report online bullying and make a formal complaint.

dialogues.text: It's not your fault. You can report those who are bothering you through official channels. There's a place in Australia that can help with this.
Formal complaint? Really work?
At least better than just holding it in. It's nothing to be ashamed of protecting yourself.
...... Okay, I'll try.
(Time passes, Louis files a complaint with the platform and eSafety)
(A few days later)
(Louis shares her experience with online bullying on her social media, gaining understanding and support from fans, and some new fans start to follow Zack)

choices.text: Suggest Louis to swallow his pride and continue maintaining his online image.

dialogues.text: Maybe you can just not respond for a while. Let things cool down on their own.
You don't have to tell me that. I know how to maintain my image.
(Louis chooses to remain silent, but her mood hasn't fully recovered)

events.summary: When faced with online bullying, the most important thing is to protect yourself, not blindly maintain your image. Using legal means to seek external help is the most courageous way to deal with problems. True respect comes from standing up for oneself.

events.title: Suspicious Money-making Invitation

dialogues.text: Finally, the class is over, and my head feels like it's going to explode.
Let's take a break somewhere, see what Bob's up to.
(Zack walks to a corner and sees Bob on his phone)
Zack, come here, I have a big news for you!
What's that? So mysterious?
I just saw an invitation on a forum. Someone messaged me privately to join a "High-profit Gold Studio". You can make a lot of money just by playing games every day!
It sounds like a really cool thing... but it's a bit strange too, right?
They also sent a link for me to register. They said all I need is a photo of my ID and bank card, and I can start making money.
Wait, ID and bank card? That sounds really wrong!
But it looks like several people have already made money, and there are screenshots.
Screenshots can be fake, and so can websites. They're asking for your personal information too urgently. It doesn't feel right.
(Appears in the corner, serious expression)
Some traps are specifically designed to attract people with "easy money".
Should we report this to the platform?
But... what if we're wrong? Won't that be too much?

choices.text: Encourage Bob to join in the reporting, protecting both themselves and others.

dialogues.text: This isn't a small issue. If someone gets scammed, the loss is more than just a little.
You're right. I'll report it now!
(Bob submits a report on the platform, and the backend confirms it has been recorded and investigated)

choices.text: Advise Bob to ignore it for now, as it's not really a scam.

dialogues.text: Maybe they're just bragging? But you should be careful.
(Bob doesn't report)
(A few days later, a news report reveals that the website is involved in large-scale fraud, and Bob regrets not acting sooner)

events.summary: When faced with suspicious invitations related to sensitive information and money, don't hesitate to report them. Not reporting allows illegal content to continue existing, causing more harm to innocent people. Speaking up is also a responsible act towards the online world.

events.title: Cybersecurity Competition

dialogues.text: The break time today seems unusually short, and I haven't even had a chance to drink water.
(Zack leans against the railing of the playground)
(Bob comes running over)
Zack! This weekend, there's a really great event. Want to go together?
What event?
It's a cybersecurity competition! Both school teachers and outside experts will be there. I heard you've been working on social media apps recently, which is perfect for you!
Cybersecurity? Competition? Isn't it quite advanced?
Not that difficult. It's mainly about teaching us how to protect our accounts, identify scammers, and how to make friends online without getting scammed.
It sounds... quite important.
Yes. When I first started using social media, I almost got into trouble.
What happened?

There was a person pretending to be a little girl chatting with me. They said they wanted to make friends and sent a bunch of photos. Then... they started threatening me, asking me to send them photos of myself, or else...
That's scary!!
Yeah. Luckily, I told my parents, and they called the police for me. The police said it was actually a bad person pretending to be a child.
It's really dangerous online...
That's why I want to bring you along to learn something. Not just for myself, but also for protecting our friends in the future!
(Bob pats Zack on the shoulder)
How about it? Want to go?

choices.text: Agree to participate in the cybersecurity competition enthusiastically.

dialogues.text: It sounds interesting, I'll go!
Great! We'll see you at the competition tomorrow!
Don't lose to me then!
(They smile at each other)

choices.text: Refuse to go.

dialogues.text: Uh... I'm not very good at this, maybe you should go by yourself?
No no no, please, Zack! You want to make friends on TikTok, right? It's super important to know about safety!
But...
Come on, stop pretending, I've already signed you up!
Okay... see you tomorrow.

events.summary: On the internet, protecting yourself isn't about luck; it's about learning. Every time you learn about new cybersecurity knowledge, you're adding an extra layer of protection. Wherever you go, having safety awareness is key to feeling safe in the world.

events.title: Fake Account Scandal

dialogues.text: Finally, the class is over, and the sun is shining outside.
(Zack pulls out his phone and browses social media casually)
Wait, what?!
(On the screen, an account named "BobRealHero" posted some strange content)
School clubs are a bunch of losers!
Some teachers are just that bad, hilarious!
This... how could Bob do this?
(Zack runs to the other side of the playground to find Bob)
Bob! Do you have any other accounts?
What? I only have one!
Look at this!
(Zack hands his phone to Bob to show him)
What? Someone's using my name to post these things?!
That's too much! It could get me in trouble at school!
Let's think... who might want to hurt you like this?
Well... I did have an argument with Derek on the basketball court yesterday...
Derek? The one who always sits in the back row?
Yeah, we had a pretty heated argument about the game rules.
The timing matches! This account was created right after your argument!
(They find Derek during lunch break)
Derek, we need to talk about something.
(Derek looks nervous when he sees them)
...... Okay, it was me. I created that account.
Why would you do this? Do you know how much trouble this could cause me?
I was just angry about the basketball game... I made the account to vent, but then I got carried away...
I'm sorry... I know I was wrong. I'll delete the account and explain to the teacher.
That's the right thing to do.
Just remember, even if you're joking, there are limits to what you should do online.

choices.text: Suspect Bob has a twin brother.

dialogues.text: Do you also have a long-lost twin brother?
Ha ha, if there's really one, at least my homework could be done for me.
Okay, joking aside, let's investigate.

choices.text: Suspect other classmates did it.

dialogues.text: I think... some classmates have been a bit unhappy with you recently.
Yeah, there were a few arguments on the basketball court.
Then the scope is narrowed down.

choices.text: Suspect Bob has sleepwalking or multiple personalities.

dialogues.text: Isn't it you sleep-talking on a small account?
Please, I've only been eating snacks, not crazy.
Then let's continue investigating.

events.summary: On the internet, impersonation and spreading rumors are not just jokes. Every careless act can cause significant harm to others. Protecting yourself also means respecting others, which is the most basic rule of the online world.

events.title: Privacy Leakage Crisis

dialogues.text: Hey, Louis is still alone in the classroom...
(Zack holds his textbook and walks towards Louis)
Louis, why haven't you been to the playground during break time recently? It must be so boring here alone.
...... I don't feel like moving.
Are you okay? Is something wrong?
Nothing... just feeling a bit烦躁.
If you want to talk about it, I'm here to listen.
(Louis is silent for a moment before speaking)
Recently, there's been a stranger leaving comments under my videos. At first, they complimented me, but then they started being strange. They knew about my after-school routine and places I often go.
What?!
Maybe it's because I've been posting selfies and check-ins too much. They've pieced together a lot of details.
Have you told the teacher?
Yes. The teacher suggested I temporarily reduce posting and not go alone. But I still feel uneasy, like I'm not safe.
You're right, Louis. It's better to be cautious.
...... Thank you, Zack. You're one of the few people who haven't laughed at me.
(Louis thanks quietly and closes his textbook, walking to the other side of the classroom)
(Zack watches her背影, feeling a bit heavy-hearted)

choices.text: Encourage Louis to temporarily close his social media accounts and take a break.

dialogues.text: Maybe you should consider temporarily closing your account, giving yourself some space to breathe.
...... Maybe it's time for a break.

choices.text: Suggest Louis to delete previous check-in posts and modify privacy settings.

dialogues.text: Should we delete those posts that might leak privacy? And set the permissions to only friends can see.
That sounds reliable. Then I can still share but won't expose myself.

choices.text: Suggest Louis to completely exit the online world and stay away from social platforms.

dialogues.text: Maybe... we should just delete all social media apps, get away from these troubles.
I like sharing... if I turn everything off, I feel like I'm missing something.
(Louis thinks for a moment before nodding)
Anyway, thank you for listening to me.
(Louis leaves the classroom)

events.summary: On the internet, every unintentional share can be used by someone with ulterior motives. Protecting your privacy isn't about being scared; it's about having the right to choose safety and freedom. Everyone should be responsible for their own information and learn to protect themselves smartly.

events.title: Refusing Strangers' Sales Pitch

dialogues.text: Today's mood is good, and the number of comments on my video last night has increased.
(Zack opens his phone to check messages)
(He receives a private message)
Hey, bro! I've just created a new account. Can you help me promote it? Post a video for me, and I'll buy you a cup of tea later!
...... Is this... a form of advertising?
(Zack furrows his brows slightly)
It doesn't seem like a big deal... but what if everyone else does this too?
(Aether leans over and whispers)
Zack, don't forget, your online account is part of you. Not everything is worth agreeing to.
But... helping someone isn't a big deal, right?
If you help one person, others might think your account can be used for advertising. Then, the people who really care about your content will slowly lose interest.
It's actually quite serious when you think about it.
Helping others is a kind gesture, but protecting your own goals is more important.

choices.text: Thank the other party for their trust and explain that I don't accept promotional requests.

dialogues.text: Thank you for your trust! I'm currently focusing on my own content, so I won't accept promotional requests for now. Good luck!
Clear and polite, perfect!

choices.text: Suggest the other party continue creating content to build their audience.

dialogues.text: Thank you! The best way is to consistently post good content. Then fans will naturally come.
Guiding the other party on the right path is also a gentle help.

choices.text: Politely refuse and recommend they apply for the official promotion of a new account.

dialogues.text: Thank you! Tiktok recently has a new account support plan. You can apply for it. It's better than relying on others.
Not only do they respect boundaries, but they also give constructive advice. Great!

events.summary: In the online world, kindness cannot replace principles. Those who respect their content direction can go further. True growth comes from helping others while protecting your own path.

events.title: Social Help Request

dialogues.text: My mood is good this morning, let's see if there's any new news on social media platforms.
(Zack opens his phone and sees a private message)
Hello! My cat ran away yesterday. Can you post a notice on your Tiktok for me? The more people see it, the better, thank you!
Oh, someone's asking for my help...
It doesn't seem too difficult, right? I'll just post it.
(Aether leans over and whispers)
Zack, helping others is a good thing, but you need to think about the direction of the platform's content.
What do you mean?
If you start accepting these requests, more and more people might come to you for help. Your account might not be what you want to show anymore.
But I don't want to be indifferent to those in need...
There are many ways to help, like recommending them to more professional platforms, which can help them and also protect our boundaries.
Yes, I understand. I'll help in a way that's appropriate.

choices.text: Suggest the other party post a notice on a local pet recovery platform.

dialogues.text: Hello! I feel for your situation! But I suggest you post a notice on a local pet recovery platform. It's faster to find your pet there. I hope you find your kitten soon!
Great response! It not only shows kindness but also respects boundaries.

choices.text: Express sympathy but explain that my account theme is not suitable for posting.

dialogues.text: Hello! I really want to help, but my account is mainly about sharing personal content. If I suddenly post a notice, it might confuse fans. But I sincerely hope you can find your cat soon!
Sometimes, explaining your stance in a gentle way is also mature.

choices.text: Recommend the other party contact the lost and found department of the school or community.

dialogues.text: Hello! If you post a notice on the bulletin board of the school or community, it might be more effective! There are many people watching, and the chance of finding your cat is greater!
Guiding others to find a more suitable channel is a wise way of helping.

events.summary: In the online world, it's important to maintain kindness, but it's also important to learn how to protect your direction and boundaries. Helping others doesn't mean abandoning your original intentions. Finding the right way to combine kindness and persistence is key.

dialogues.text: On Sunday night, Zack didn't excitedly hold his tablet as usual, but quietly leaned against the sofa, watching TV while slowly falling asleep.
Mrs. William gently covered him with a blanket, watching her son's steady breathing, a smile appearing on her face for the first time in a long time.
(softly) Recently, you... seem really different.
You've started facing problems and are daring to challenge things you used to be afraid of.
Before, you always hid behind me and didn't dare to speak... now you can stand on the stage in front of others and tell them what's right.
She gently touched Zack's hair, as if comforting the timid boy from the past and embracing the child growing up before her eyes.
The TV screen was still on, but the sound had been turned down to a minimum. Aether quietly sat on the sofa's edge, the backpack open, as if also feeling at ease and falling asleep.

events.title: Celebration at the Quick Lunch Restaurant

dialogues.text: The day after the live broadcast ended, Zack and Bob met at a quick lunch restaurant to celebrate their first "co-hosting task".
Bob! Did you see the number of viewers yesterday? It was explosive!
Hahaha, your "I don't sound like a girl" joke was so funny, the comments went crazy!
Thank you for helping me with the comments last night. Without you, I would have panicked.
They laughed and put fried chicken, hamburgers, and French fries on the table. Aether quietly sat in Zack's backpack, his ears twitching slightly.
(hand on her face) You guys looked like you were on the headlines just now.
But... the live broadcast yesterday you guys didn't go offline, which was kind of a "miracle".
(softly) Is she complimenting us...?
(scratching his head) Um... thank you?
Although Louis's tone was still prickly, she didn't refuse to join them, nor did she leave alone.
Like the sudden burst of sunshine on this unexpected afternoon, some relationships might be quietly changing.

events.title: Plagiarism Accusation Scandal

dialogues.text: The break time finally arrived, and I just wanted to lie down and do nothing.
(Zack swipes his phone)
(He receives a private message from Tiktok_User)
Did you copy my video style? And use my BGM? Don't think I didn't see it!
If you don't delete your work, I'll report you to the platform and get your account banned!
What? I didn't copy at all!
(I'm feeling a bit confused) But if it's really reported, what if my account has problems...
(Zack thinks about asking Louis for help)
(On the other side of the playground, Louis is resting)
Louis, can I ask you something?
What's up? You look like you're about to cry.
Someone said I copied, and they want to report me... but I really made the video myself.
Don't panic. What exactly did they say you copied?
They said I copied the style, and used his BGM. But my editing is original, and the BGM is from free materials.
The style of a video doesn't need to be copyrighted, and as long as the music is from a legitimate source, it's fine. The key is, you need to prepare evidence.
What should I do?
Make sure to keep all your production records and screenshots of source materials. With these, even if you're reported, you can appeal.
System prompt: What do you want to do?

choices.text: Delete the work directly, put an end to it.

dialogues.text: Okay, I'll delete it, I'm too lazy to cause trouble.
(Zack deletes the work)
(But Tiktok_User still reported Zack, causing his account to be temporarily frozen)
...... Deleting it doesn't work, he still reported me.
(Zack quickly organizes evidence and files an appeal)
(A few days later)
(The platform approves the appeal, confirming Zack's innocence, and his account is unbanned)

choices.text: Stick to originality, prepare evidence for appeal.

dialogues.text: I didn't copy, I'll use evidence to protect myself.
(Zack saves his editing records and screenshots of BGM authorization)
(Although Tiktok_User eventually filed a complaint)
(Zack submits an appeal document)
(The platform confirms Zack's innocence and his account is restored)
Look, those who are innocent have nothing to fear.

choices.text: First message to explain, but make sure to back up evidence.

dialogues.text: I'll explain first, and also prepare evidence.
(Zack sends a private message explaining his creative process and backs up all source materials)
(Tiktok_User still filed a complaint against Zack)
(Zack submits evidence for appeal)
(The platform confirms Zack's innocence and his account is restored)
Thankfully, I've been prepared.

events.summary: The internet is not always about reasoning. When faced with accusations, having complete evidence is the most powerful protection. Taking proactive steps to save your creative process and source information can protect your rights when disputes arise. Trust the rules, but also believe in your own efforts.

events.title: Enthusiastic Fan Messages

dialogues.text: Mmm... breakfast smells so good today...
(Phone suddenly vibrates frantically)
So many messages?
(Opens phone to find dozens of DMs from a fan)
Zack! I absolutely LOVE your videos!
I watch them every day! You're so adorable!
I know you live in Melbourne! I'm here too!
Can we meet up? I want to be friends!
Why aren't you responding :( I've been waiting forever
Are you at school? I can come find you!
This is... kind of scary...
This fan seems a bit too enthusiastic.
Remember, even with fans, you need to maintain appropriate boundaries.
But wouldn't it hurt their feelings if I just reject them...
Protecting your safety and privacy is more important. The key is to be polite but firm.

choices.text: Thank them politely but firmly decline meeting in person

dialogues.text: Thank you for loving my videos! Your support means a lot to me.
However, for safety reasons, I don't meet up with online friends. I hope you understand.
Oh... I understand. Sorry for being too excited.
I'll keep supporting your videos!
Well done, you showed gratitude while protecting yourself.

choices.text: Politely explain being too busy to respond to DMs

dialogues.text: Thanks for your support! Recently, I've been quite busy with school and making videos, so I might not be able to respond to DMs.
Okay... I'll wait until you're free...
(The fan still seems to be waiting for a response)
This might make them keep expecting a reply...

choices.text: Block the fan directly

dialogues.text: This is too scary, I'm just going to block them.
(Zack blocks the fan)
While you protected yourself, other fans might think you're too cold...
(Some fans question your attitude after seeing this)

choices.text: Suggest chatting during livestreams instead

dialogues.text: Thank you for your support! While we can't meet in person, we can chat during my livestreams.
That way everyone can join in, it's safer and more fun!
Really? That's great! I'll definitely join your streams!
That's a good idea - maintaining boundaries while not hurting feelings.

events.summary: In the online world, interacting with fans requires maintaining appropriate boundaries. Setting limits politely but firmly protects both yourself and shows respect for others. Choosing appropriate ways to communicate makes interactions safer and more meaningful.

events.title: Way to School

dialogues.text: Another ordinary morning...
(While walking to school, Zack checks his social media messages)
Hi Zack! I love your videos! Could you teach me how to edit? Maybe we can meet up?
Hmm... should I reply?
(A familiar voice interrupts his thoughts)
Still checking your phone while walking? You'll trip.
Oh! Louis! You startled me.
Let me guess - another fan asking for private lessons?
Yeah... how did you know?
Please, I get hundreds of those. Amateur creators are so predictable with their responses.
What do you mean?
Look, you're still new to this. Meeting fans privately? That's literally Social Media Safety 101.
I've been doing this way longer than you. Want some advice? Though you probably need it more than I do.
Well... what would you do?
Obviously, never meet fans in person. You have no idea who they really are.
Even I, with my experience, never share personal details. Not that you have as many followers to worry about...

choices.text: Make a public tutorial video instead

dialogues.text: I'll make a tutorial video for everyone to watch!
Well, well... looks like you can actually make smart decisions.
Just don't copy my style. Though I doubt you could anyway.
(At least she approves...)

choices.text: Just block and ignore the message

dialogues.text: Maybe I should just block them...
Ugh, that's so amateur. You can't just block everyone.
Learn to handle fans properly. Though with your small following, you have time to practice.
(She's right, but did she have to say it like that?)

choices.text: Agree to a quick meeting to help them

dialogues.text: Maybe just a quick meeting wouldn't hurt...
Are you seriously that naive? No wonder you're still a small creator.
When something happens, don't come crying to me. I warned you.
(Maybe this wasn't such a good idea...)

events.summary: Online safety isn't just about protecting yourself - it's about being professional. Never meet fans in private, no matter how genuine they seem. Keep interactions public and maintain clear boundaries.
